item.name: Client Search Auth User Schema Validation

exec: var Ajv = require('ajv'); // Added the require statement for Ajv
var ajv = new Ajv(); // Instantiated Ajv

request.description:
The endpoint retrieves a list of clients with a specified page size and page number. 

### Response
The response is in JSON format and includes the following fields:
- `totalCount` (number) - Total count of clients.
- `values` (array) - An array of client objects with the following properties:
  - `id` (string) - The client's ID.
  - `legacyId` (number) - The client's legacy ID.
  - `bridgeId` (string) - The client's bridge ID.
  - `name` (string) - The client's name.
  - `number` (string) - The client's number.
  - `cityName` (string) - The name of the city associated with the client.
  - `stateProvince` (string) - The state or province associated with the client.
  - `employeeFirstName` (string) - The first name of the employee associated with the client.
  - `employeeLastName` (string) - The last name of the employee associated with the client.
  - `employeeInternalName` (string) - The internal name of the employee associated with the client.
  - `dateTimeUTCStamp` (string) - The timestamp in UTC format.
- `links` (array) - An array of links with the following properties:
  - `href` (string) - The URL of the link.
  - `rel` (string) - The relationship of the link.
  - `method` (string) - The HTTP method associated with the link.

request.description:
# GridsTokens

This endpoint is used to obtain the OAuth 2.0 token from the specified endpoint. The user needs to write a pre-request script to obtain the OAuth 2.0 token using the authentication configuration details such as client ID, client secret, authorization endpoint, token endpoint, and scope to configure the OAuth 2.0 authentication.

## Request Body
- applicationName (text)
- machineName (text)
- siteName (text)
- applicationLaunchPath (text)
- applicationVersion (text)

## Response
- Status: 200
- Content-Type: text/plain
- OAuth 2.0 token
